intro: Parosela weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's parosela, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its erect stem and clusters of bell-shaped, white to pale blue flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
